TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SecAccessible extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: An enumeration whose values specify when a keychain item should be readable.

remarks.para: There are a number of axis to consider for the accessible settings of an item.
Whether the information should be made accessible without entering a passcode, the device being unlocked or always available.
Another one is whether the information should be locked to this device, or whether the information can migrate to a new device via a backup restore.
This value is used by the constructor and surfaced as a property of the .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible AfterFirstUnlock = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The data is only available after the first time the device has been unlocked after booting.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible AfterFirstUnlockThisDeviceOnly = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The data is only available after the first time the device has been unlocked after booting.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible Always = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible AlwaysThisDeviceOnly = int32(5)
.field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible Invalid = int32(-1)
.field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible WhenPasscodeSetThisDeviceOnly = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Limits access to the item to both this device and requires a passcode to be set and the data is only available if the device is currently unlocked.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible WhenUnlocked = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The data is only available when the device is unlocked.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Security.SecAccessible WhenUnlockedThisDeviceOnly = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Limits access to the item to this device and the device being unlocked.
